Chapter 7: The Holy One, Bodhisattva Forest of Merits, Asks (2)
At that time, the holy one, Bodhisattva-mahÄsattva Forest of Merits, relying on the characteristics of all dharmas, said to the Buddha:
World-Honored One!
The World-Honored One says that bodhisattvas are well-versed in the characteristics of dharmas.
World-Honored One!
How are bodhisattvas well-versed in the characteristics of dharmas?
World-Honored One!

How many kinds of dharmas are bodhisattvas able to understand, such that they are called well-versed in the characteristics of all dharmas, and the TathÄgata speaks of bodhisattvas being well-versed in the characteristics of all dharmas?
At that time, the Buddha told Bodhisattva-mahÄsattva Forest of Merits:
Excellent, excellent!
Forest of Merits!
You are now able to ask the Buddha about this meaning.
Forest of Merits!
You are able to bring peace and happiness to all sentient beings, fulfilling all their needs.
Forest of Merit!
You are able to have compassion for all humans and gods, bringing them much peace and benefit, and are thus able to ask me about this meaning.
Excellent, excellent!
Forest of Merit!
Now listen single-mindedly, listen single-mindedly, as I will explain it to you.
Forest of Merit!
The characteristics of all dharmas are of three kinds.
What are the three?
Namely, the characteristics of false discrimination, the characteristics of causes and conditions, and the characteristics of ultimate truth.
Forest of Merit!
What are the characteristics of false discrimination?
Namely, the essence of the dharmas spoken of by names and characteristics, and various characteristics, names, functions, meanings, and so forth.
Forest of Merit!
What are the characteristics of the causes and conditions of all dharmas?

Namely, the twelve links of dependent arising, where this dharma arises in dependence on that dharma, namely, in dependence on ignorance, there are karmic formations, up to the arising of a great mass of suffering.
Forest of Merit!
What are the characteristics of the ultimate truth of all dharmas?

It is said that the essence of the true suchness of all dharmas is realized by bodhisattvas through correct mindfulness and practice, and through single-minded practice of the non-dual Dharma. Having realized that Dharma, they attain the accomplishment of supreme perfect enlightenment.
Forest of Merit!
It is like a person whose eyes have myodesopsia, which is a fault of eye consciousness.
Forest of Merit!
False discrimination is also like this.
Forest of Merit!
It is like a person whose eyes have myodesopsia seeing the appearances of hair nets, ropes, and black sesame seeds, such as blue, yellow, red, and white.
Forest of Merit!
The characteristics of dependent origination are also like this.
Forest of Merit!
It is like a person whose eyes are clear and free from turbidity, free from the fault of eye myodesopsia, who then sees the inherent nature of objects without giving rise to confusion.
Forest of Merit!
The characteristics of the ultimate truth are also like this.
Forest of Merit!

It is like a pure lapis lazuli placed in a blue color, then emitting the light of a great indranÄ«la maá¹‡i jewel, and the light of the great indranÄ«la maá¹‡i jewel appears before it, confusing sentient beings into thinking it is a real jewel.
Forest of Merit!
That very pure lapis lazuli placed in a red color, then emits the light of a red padma maá¹‡i jewel and appears before it, confusing sentient beings into thinking it is a red jewel.
Forest of Merit!
That very pure lapis lazuli placed in a green color, then emits the light of a green maá¹‡i jewel and appears before it, confusing sentient beings into thinking it is a green jewel.
Forest of Merit!
That very pure lapis lazuli placed in a yellow color, then emits the light of a golden maá¹‡i jewel and appears before it, confusing sentient beings into thinking it is a golden jewel.
Forest of Merit!
Just like the various different colors within that pure lapis lazuli;
In the same way, you should know that the essence of the false imagination of names, phrases, and perfuming within the characteristics of other-dependent causes and conditions is also like this.
Forest of Merit!

Just as the pure lapis lazuli causes the colors of Indra's blue and great Indra's blue, and the colors of red, green, and yellow, to manifest as various jewels in front of it, and deceives sentient beings into regarding them all as jewels.
Forest of Merit!
In the same way, you should know that the names, phrases, and false imagination within the characteristics of other-dependent causes and conditions are also like this.
Forest of Merit!
Just like the pure white essence of lapis lazuli, you should know that the other-dependent causes and conditions are also like this.
Forest of Merit!

The pure nature of beryl is devoid of the colors of Indra's blue and great Indra's blue, and is devoid of the substances of those blue jewels, red, green, and golden jewels. Such a substance is always and constantly devoid of all such jewel substances.
Forest of Merit!

In the nature of dependent origination, those false discriminations of names and phrases are always and constantly devoid of such a nature of false discrimination of names and phrases. You should understand this.
Forest of Merit!
You should understand that names and phrases are discriminated based on dependent origination.
Forest of Merit!
Because of falsely grasping at names and phrases based on dependent origination, one sees dependent origination.
Forest of Merit!
Because of falsely grasping at the characteristics of false discrimination based on dependent origination, one sees the characteristic of ultimate truth.
Forest of Merit!

Bodhisattvas are able to know the characteristics of false discrimination as they really are within those characteristics of causes and conditions. At that time, bodhisattvas are said to be able to know the signlessness of all dharmas.
Forest of Merit!
If bodhisattvas know the characteristics of conditioned arising, and know conditioned arising as it really is, they are able to know the characteristics of defiled dharmas as they really are;
having been able to know the characteristics of defiled dharmas as they really are, they are able to know the characteristics of the ultimate truth;
having been able to know the characteristics of the ultimate truth as they really are, they are able to know the characteristics of pure dharmas as they really are.
Forest of Merit!

If bodhisattvas are able to know the signless dharmas as they really are within the dharmas of other-dependent causes and conditions, having known them as they really are, they will be able to avoid defiled dharmas;
having avoided defiled dharmas, they will attain the realization of the characteristics of all pure dharmas.
Forest of Merit!

Bodhisattvas can truly understand the characteristics of false dharmas, can understand the characteristics of dependent origination, can understand the characteristics of ultimate truth, and the characteristic of non-characteristics. They can truly understand the characteristics of defilement and purity, the characteristics of dharmas apart from defilement, and the characteristics of dharmas that realize purity.
Forest of Merit!
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas should understand dharmas in this way.
Therefore, the Buddha says that bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas understand all dharmas.
At that time, the World-Honored One spoke a verse, saying:
Truly understanding all dharmas, one abandons the characteristics of defiled dharmas;
Having abandoned the characteristics of defiled dharmas, one realizes the pure dharmas.
Not observing the faults of conditioned arising, the harm of laziness and negligence,
All dharmas are always unmoving, apart from characteristics, called a bodhisattva.

Chapter 8: The Holy One Accomplishing the Ultimate Truth Bodhisattva's Questions (2) Chapter 8: The Holy One Accomplishing the Ultimate Truth Bodhisattva's Questions At that time, the holy one Accomplishing the Ultimate Truth Bodhisattva, relying on the characteristic of non-substance and the characteristic of ultimate truth, addressed the Buddha, saying:
World-Honored One!
World-Honored One!
I was alone in a secluded place, and a thought arose in my mind:

'The TathÄgata has variously explained the intrinsic characteristics of the aggregates, namely, being able to know the characteristics of arising and ceasing, apart from the causes and conditions of the various sense bases, giving rise to various activities;
Thus he has explained the intrinsic characteristics of the truths, namely, knowing, detaching from, realizing, and cultivating;
Thus he has explained the intrinsic characteristics of the various realms, the various specific characteristics, the various realm characteristics, and the immeasurable realm characteristics;

Thus, the self-nature, antidotes, cultivation, non-arising, and increasing and expanding of the mindfulness, right effort, supernormal powers, faculties, powers, enlightenment factors, and path have been explained.

The World-Honored One has also said that all dharmas are originally without substance, all dharmas are originally unborn, all dharmas are originally unceasing, all dharmas are originally quiescent, and all dharmas are originally in nirvana by their intrinsic nature.
World-Honored One!
Therefore, I ask the Tathagata about this meaning. What was the intention of the Tathagata in making such statements?
At that time, the Buddha told the Bodhisattva Accomplishing the Ultimate Truth:
Excellent, excellent!
Accomplishing the Ultimate Truth!
You are able to give rise to such understanding and contemplation with correct mindfulness.
He further said:
Excellent!
Accomplishing the Ultimate Truth!
You are now able to ask the Buddha about this meaning.
Why is it so?
You ask this meaning in order to bring peace and comfort to all sentient beings, to benefit all sentient beings, and to bring peace and comfort to all heavenly beings and humans.
Accomplisher of the Ultimate Meaning!

Listen single-mindedly. Why do I say this? All dharmas are originally without substance or characteristics, all dharmas are originally unborn, all dharmas are originally unceasing, all dharmas are originally quiescent, and all dharmas are originally nirvÄá¹‡a?
Accomplisher of the Ultimate Meaning!
My intention is based on the three kinds of non-substance and non-characteristics of all dharmas, and thus I say that all dharmas are without self-substance and characteristics.
What are the three?
Namely, based on the non-substance and non-characteristics of all dharmas, the non-substance and non-characteristics of birth, and the non-substance and non-characteristics of ultimate truth.
Accomplisher of the Ultimate Meaning!
The non-substance and non-characteristics of all dharmas refer to the characteristics of all discriminations.
Why is it so?
Because those dharmas are spoken of according to their names and characteristics, and do not have their own substance, therefore I say they have no self-nature characteristics.
Accomplisher of the Ultimate Meaning!
What are the characteristics of the substance of the non-arising of dharmas?
It means the characteristics of the substance of the non-existence of dharmas.
Why is it so?
Because those arising dharmas rely on the power of causes and conditions, not on their own substance characteristics, therefore I say they have the characteristics of the substance of non-arising.
Accomplisher of the Ultimate Meaning!
What are the characteristics of the substance of the ultimate truth?
Accomplisher of the Ultimate Meaning!

As for the characteristics of the substance of the ultimate truth, all dharmas are originally without the substance of arising, therefore I say all dharmas have the characteristics of the substance of non-self, because they rely on causes and conditions to arise and because they rely on the characteristics of the substance of the non-existence of the ultimate truth.
Why is it so?
Accomplisher of the Ultimate Meaning!
The characteristic of pure observation among all dharmas, I say that is the characteristic of the ultimate truth.
Accomplisher of the Ultimate Meaning!
Because in the characteristics of other-power, there is the pure contemplation. Therefore, I say that the ultimate truth has no self-nature characteristics.
Accomplishing the ultimate truth!
All dharmas have no characteristics of accomplishment. Therefore, I say that the ultimate truth has no self-nature characteristics.
Why is it so?
Accomplishing the ultimate truth!
Dharmas are without self, and the characteristics of the essence of no-self. Therefore, I say that all dharmas have no self-nature characteristics.
Accomplishing the ultimate truth!
Because those dharmas are named based on no essence, therefore I say that the ultimate truth has no self-nature characteristics.
Accomplishing the ultimate truth!
Just as a sky-flower has no self-nature characteristics, the self-nature characteristics of all dharmas are also like this.
Therefore, I say that all dharmas have no self-nature characteristics. The Dharma should be like this, and should be known.
Accomplishing the ultimate truth!
It is like an illusion creating various forms and appearances. The dharmas of causes and conditions are also like this, without the characteristics of self-nature.
Therefore, I say that all dharmas are without the characteristics of self-nature.
Siddhatthaka!
The ultimate truth is also like this, without the characteristics of self-nature.
Therefore, I say that the ultimate truth is without the characteristics of self-nature.
Siddhatthaka!
Just as the color of a sky-flower is said to be without a real form,
In the same way, the ultimate truth is also like this, without the characteristics of self-nature.
Siddhatthaka!
Based on these three kinds of dharmas being without the characteristics of self-nature, I say that all dharmas are without the characteristics of self-nature.
Furthermore, Siddhatthaka!

Based on the characteristics being without the characteristics of self-nature, I say that all dharmas are without the characteristics of self-nature. Those dharmas are originally unborn, those dharmas are originally unceasing, those dharmas are originally quiescent, those dharmas are originally nirvÄá¹‡a.
Why is it so?
Accomplishing the ultimate truth!
If all dharmas are without the characteristic of self-nature, those dharmas do not arise;
if dharmas do not arise, those dharmas do not cease;
if they do not cease and do not arise, those dharmas are originally quiescent;
if dharmas are originally quiescent, those dharmas are originally pure;
if dharmas are originally pure, those dharmas are originally nirvÄá¹‡a.
If it is so, those dharmas have not a single dharma that can cease and enter nirvÄá¹‡a.
Accomplishing the ultimate truth!
Therefore, I rely on that characteristic to say those dharmas are without the characteristic of self-nature. Therefore, I say all dharmas are originally non-arisen.
Furthermore, accomplishing the ultimate truth!
The ultimate truth is named based on non-self. Therefore, I rely on the ultimate truth being without the characteristic of self-nature to say the dharmas are originally non-arisen.
Why is it so?
Accomplishing the ultimate truth!

It is named by the principle of the non-self of dharmas in the ultimate truth. Therefore, it is called the characteristic of the absence of self-nature in the ultimate truth, the eternal abiding of the essence of all dharmas at all times, referring to the essence of the unconditioned, free from the characteristics of association with all afflictions.
If a dharma is at all times and eternally dependent on the essence of that dharma, it does not arise or cease, because it is unconditioned.
If a dharma is unconditioned, that dharma is originally quiescent;
if a dharma is originally quiescent, that dharma is originally nirvÄá¹‡a, because it is free from the characteristics of association with all afflictions and poisons.

Therefore, it is named by the principle of the non-self of dharmas in the ultimate truth. I say that all dharmas have the characteristic of absence of self-nature, that all dharmas are originally unborn, all dharmas are originally unceasing, all dharmas are originally quiescent, and all dharmas are originally nirvÄá¹‡a.
Siddhatthika!

All sentient beings in the realm of sentient beings do not know or realize the distinctions in the essence of false discrimination, nor can they know the distinctions in the essence of other-powered dependent origination, nor do they see the distinctions in the essence of ultimate truth. Therefore, I say that the three kinds of dharmas have no self-nature.
Accomplishing the ultimate truth!

Sentient beings falsely discriminate the characteristics of the essence of dharmas, the essence of other-powered dharmas, and the essence of ultimate truth. They falsely discriminate the characteristics of the essence of names, speak of dependent origination dharmas, and speak of ultimate truth dharmas.
Accomplishing the ultimate truth!

All sentient beings thus speak and thus enjoy using the mind of names, following the mind, and being led by the use of names. Relying on discriminating the characteristics of the essence of names, they cling to the essence of other-powered dharmas and dependent origination dharmas, and the essence of ultimate truth.
Accomplishing the ultimate truth!

In this way, they grasp at the dependent nature, falsely grasping at the nature of dharmas through causes and conditions. Relying on those causes and conditions, they give rise to the nature of the dependent in the future, and are defiled by afflictions, karma, and birth. They transmigrate through the six destinies, suffering for a long time, unable to escape the bonds of suffering in birth and death, namely the destinies of hell, animals, hungry ghosts, asuras, gods, and humans.
Accomplisher of the Ultimate Truth!

I teach the non-arising of all dharmas for those sentient beings who do not plant good roots, who are unable to purify all evil karma, who are unable to accomplish the power of good roots, who have little faith in the Dharma, and who do not accumulate the karma of merit and wisdom.

Those sentient beings who hear my explanation of the arising of conditioned activities through the combination of causes and conditions, those sentient beings will know that all phenomena are impermanent, unstable, cannot be relied upon, and change and cease in various ways, and will give rise to a mind of fear and a mind of detachment towards all conditioned activities.

Having given rise to a mind of fear and a mind of detachment, those sentient beings will not engage in evil dharmas but will cultivate good dharmas. Those who cultivate good dharmas will rely on the causes of good dharmas, those who have not planted good roots will plant various good roots, those whose sinful karma is not pure will purify their sinful karma, and those whose faculties are not mature will be able to bring them to maturity. Relying on the power of maturing those good roots, they will be able to have much faith in the Dharma. Those who have much faith in the Dharma will be able to gather the treasury of merit and wisdom.
Siddhatthika!
Although those sentient beings will plant good roots, up to being able to gather the treasury of all merit and wisdom, Siddhatthika!

Yet those sentient beings do not truly understand the essence of those conditioned phenomena, the characteristic of the essence of non-arising, and the characteristic of the essence of the ultimate truth of non-existence. Because they do not truly understand, they are unable to generate aversion towards all conditioned activities and are unable to depart from them.
Therefore, those sentient beings do not attain liberation from the defilements of afflictions, the defilements of karma, and the defilements of birth.
Accomplisher of the Ultimate Truth!

The TathÄgata, for the sake of those sentient beings, again teaches that Dharma - namely, the non-existence of causes and conditions and the non-existence of the ultimate truth - causing those sentient beings to generate a mind of aversion towards conditioned activities, in order to attain liberation from the defilements of afflictions, the defilements of karma, and the defilements of birth.

Those sentient beings who hear my teaching, in the characteristics of non-arising of those dharmas, in the false discrimination of all dharmas, and in the characteristic of the absence of essence in ultimate truth, will be able to give rise to right faith, contemplate those dharmas, realize them as they are, and not give rise to attachment in the dependent nature, falsely discriminating the characteristics of the essence of dharmas. They will only know that they are merely names and functions, that they are merely in accordance with names and functions, and that they are merely in accordance with names and functions in order to eliminate those afflictions.

Therefore, those sentient beings will be able to extinguish the characteristics of dependent causes and conditions, and based on the power of wisdom in the present Dharma, they will sever all future causes and conditions.
Therefore, based on that correct view of causes and conditions, they will be able to detach from all conditioned activities;
having become disgusted with all conditioned activities, they will attain true liberation, far removed from the defilements of karma, afflictions, and birth.
Siddhatthika!

In my well-taught Dharma, well-intentioned Dharma, well-disciplined Dharma, well-purified Dharma, and pure Dharma, I unmistakenly rely on various natures to teach various Dharma characteristics.

Therefore, the Buddha's intention, relying on these three kinds of Dharma without essence or characteristics, teaches the sÅ«tras of provisional meaning, namely, all dharmas are originally unborn, originally unceasing, originally quiescent, and originally nirvÄá¹‡a.

If there are sentient beings who have not planted any supreme wholesome roots, who are unable to purify all evil karma, who are unable to fully mature all wholesome roots, who have little faith in the Dharma, who lack supreme resolve, who do not accumulate the treasury of merit and wisdom, who have a straightforward mind and nature, and who are unable to discern what is Dharma and what is not Dharma, what should be accepted and what should be abandoned, and who practice while clinging to their own views - even if those sentient beings hear my Dharma, they will still not know what it means.

' Therefore, sentient beings, if they are able to wholeheartedly accept and uphold the sÅ«tras, copy them, preserve them after copying, read and demonstrate them, make offerings, explain them to others, recite them constantly, rejoice in them and give them to others, but are unable to practice them as they are in reality, it is because they do not know my profound intention, because they are not yet enlightened.

' Yet those sentient beings, relying on this view, give rise to wrong views regarding all dharmas, falling into wrong views due to the absence of the characteristics of dharmas, seeing that all dharmas are without characteristics.

You should know, Accomplisher of the Ultimate Meaning!
